p: Pneumonia and lower respiratory tract infections caused 2.6 million deaths in 2017 globally, and it is the fourth leading cause of death worldwide [ 1]. The annual incidence of community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) in the United States was 25 cases per 10 000 adults, with the incidence rising to 63 and 164 per 10 000 population in those older than 65 and 80 years, respectively [ 2].
